jfilesyslib

Class MountOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • jfilesyslib.MountOptions

  • public class MountOptions
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains some common mount options
    Author:
    Marc Miltenberger

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MountOptions() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      DriveType getDrivetype()
      Returns the drive type (supported only on Windows) The default value is HARD_DRIVE.
      int getThreadCount()
      Returns the number of threads used for the file system
      boolean isMacOSXLocal()
      Returns whether the file system should be mounted with the local flag on Mac OS X
      This feature is turned off by default, because it may cause various problems.
      boolean isSyncMounting()
      Returns true if the mounting process should be synchronous.
      boolean isUnixOwnerImpersonateAllFiles()
      If this feature is turned on, all files and directories will have the user, who has mounted the file system as their owner.
      boolean isUnixOwnerImpersonateNewFiles()
      If this feature is turned on, new files and directories will have the user, who has mounted the file system as their owner.
      void setDrivetype(DriveType drivetype)
      Sets the drive type (supported only on Windows) The default value is HARD_DRIVE.
      void setMacOSXLocal(boolean macOSXLocal)
      Sets whether the file system should be mounted with the local flag on Mac OS X
      This feature is turned off by default, because it may cause various problems.
      void setSyncMounting(boolean syncMounting)
      If the actual parameter is true, the mount method acts synchronous.
      void setThreadCount(int threadCount)
      Sets the number of threads to use
      void setUnixOwnerImpersonateAllFiles(boolean unixOwnerImpersonate)
      If this feature is turned on, all files and directories will have the user, who has mounted the file system as their owner.
      void setUnixOwnerImpersonateNewFiles(boolean unixOwnerImpersonate)
      If this feature is turned on, new files and directories will have the user, who has mounted the file system as their owner.

      • MountOptions

        public MountOptions()

    • Method Detail

      • getDrivetype

        public DriveType getDrivetype()
        Returns the drive type (supported only on Windows)

        The default value is HARD_DRIVE.

        Returns:
        the drive type (supported only on Windows)

      • setDrivetype

        public void setDrivetype(DriveType drivetype)
        Sets the drive type (supported only on Windows)

        The default value is HARD_DRIVE.

        Parameters:
        drivetype - the drive type

      • isSyncMounting

        public boolean isSyncMounting()
        Returns true if the mounting process should be synchronous.
        Then the mount method does only return true if the mounting process has been completed successfully
        and the file system is usable

        This feature is turned on by default.

        Returns:
        true iff synchronous mounting is enabled

      • setSyncMounting

        public void setSyncMounting(boolean syncMounting)
        If the actual parameter is true, the mount method acts synchronous.
        It does only return true if the mounting process has been completed successfully

        This feature is turned on by default.

        Parameters:
        syncMounting - the new value

      • isUnixOwnerImpersonateNewFiles

        public boolean isUnixOwnerImpersonateNewFiles()
        If this feature is turned on, new files and directories will have the user, who has mounted the file system as their owner.

        This feature is turned on by default.

        Returns:
        the unixOwnerImpersonate value

      • setUnixOwnerImpersonateNewFiles

        public void setUnixOwnerImpersonateNewFiles(boolean unixOwnerImpersonate)
        If this feature is turned on, new files and directories will have the user, who has mounted the file system as their owner.

        This feature is turned on by default.

        Parameters:
        unixOwnerImpersonate - the new value

      • isUnixOwnerImpersonateAllFiles

        public boolean isUnixOwnerImpersonateAllFiles()
        If this feature is turned on, all files and directories will have the user, who has mounted the file system as their owner.

        This feature is turned off by default.

        Returns:
        the unixOwnerImpersonate value

      • setUnixOwnerImpersonateAllFiles

        public void setUnixOwnerImpersonateAllFiles(boolean unixOwnerImpersonate)
        If this feature is turned on, all files and directories will have the user, who has mounted the file system as their owner.

        This feature is turned off by default.

        Parameters:
        unixOwnerImpersonate - the new value

      • getThreadCount

        public int getThreadCount()
        Returns the number of threads used for the file system
        Returns:
        the thread count

      • setThreadCount

        public void setThreadCount(int threadCount)
        Sets the number of threads to use
        Parameters:
        threadCount - the thread count

      • isMacOSXLocal

        public boolean isMacOSXLocal()
        Returns whether the file system should be mounted with the local flag on Mac OS X
        This feature is turned off by default, because it may cause various problems.
        Returns:
        whether the file system should be mounted with the local flag
        See Also:
        http://fuse4x.github.com/options.html#local

      • setMacOSXLocal

        public void setMacOSXLocal(boolean macOSXLocal)
        Sets whether the file system should be mounted with the local flag on Mac OS X
        This feature is turned off by default, because it may cause various problems.
        Parameters:
        macOSXLocal - whether the local flag should be set
        See Also:
        http://fuse4x.github.com/options.html#local
